intro: Hibbertia simulans, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Hibbertia simulans is a member of the Dilleniaceae family and is well adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its natural habitat. It plays an important role in the ecological systems of its native region, providing nectar for native pollinators.
